metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5266 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Incutio XML-RPC (IXR) Library, as used in WordPress before 3.9.2 and Drupal 6.x before 6.33 and 7.x before 7.31, does not limit the number of elements in an XML document, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a large document, a different vulnerability than CVE-2014-5265.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5266` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.9.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 3.9.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 3.9.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyseventeen - 3.9.2+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 3.9.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.9.2+dfsg-1').
